AREA IX.
LABORATORIES
Exhibit G
Safety & Maintenance
Guidelines

Fire Extinguisher are present in the
Stenography Laboratory and
Computer Laboratory
Fire Alarms are in place.

Disaster Prevention and Safety
Training in Cooperation with LGU
Police Unit
Disaster Prevention and
Safety Training in
Cooperation with LGU
Police Unit

PHYSICAL PLANT AND SECURITY
SERVICES ORGANIZATIONAL CHART
Disaster Prevention and
Safety Training in
Cooperation with LGU
Police Unit

Maintenance of Laboratory
At the beginning of the semester, the
students were oriented with the guidelines
they should abide while working in the
laboratory.
The students were oriented with the
location and use of the first-aid kits, fire
extinguishers and other safety devices
available in the laboratory.
Precautionary measures are discussed
before the proper laboratory sessions.
The use of various laboratory tools and
equipment were demonstrated by the
laboratory technician and the faculty
among the students.

Maintenance of Laboratory
The lights, fans and other equipment were
strictly monitored/turned off right after the
class to minimize the use of electricity with
exception to some equipment placed
within laboratory premises which are
under use.
Every day, before and after classes, the
utility personnel clean the laboratory
rooms and maintain the arrangements of
chairs and tables and other furniture in
the laboratory.
The number of chairs in the laboratory
rooms was minimized to allow mobility
while working.

Maintenance of Computer
Laboratory
Schedule of general cleaning and
maintenance of all computers in
computer laboratory was
conducted every semestral break
specifically two weeks after the final
examination.
Maintenance of Stenography
Laboratory
Schedule of general cleaning and
maintenance of all stenography
machines in the laboratory was
conducted every semestral break
specifically two weeks after the final
examination.

Cleaning & Maintenance of
Computer Laboratory

Cleaning & Maintenance of
Stenography Laboratory

Maintenance personnel while
cleaning and fixing fixtures in the
laboratory.
